Articles.Content:
As I observe kerbals during a typical launch or reentry, I can't help but feel that something is missing. Some appear terrified, others delight at the extreme situation - but none really show the effects of extreme g forces applied to them. They're the same as in space or on ground.

Perhaps some new, minimalistic animations to express g-force effects on Kerbals would be in order? Such as head tilting back against the back of helmet (when accelerating) or front (when decelerating). It's a little something that would greatly enhance the game's atmosphere!

Some examples:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/P6d3CQ9tQuM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

(Well, I guess Kerbals don't need help there)

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xuqf_6oplMc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

... then there are those badass guys... well, they still get affected!

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Yjg6mRFzZzE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Here's some more reference material!

We love to watch our Kerbals on missions. If they reacted to the environment changes other than by changing from terrified to elated and back expressions, that'd be stellar! It's a little something that feels it should be there, like that smoke FX on launch/landing.
